Context:
Program Name: Bachelor of Business Administration (Trades Management) (Honours) (Pathway Business Trades)
Code: B305
Credential: Honours Bachelor's Degree
Method of Study: Online
Duration: 5 semesters (with up to 8 years for completion part-time)
Starting Months: January, May, September
Centre: Business
School: Management
Location: St. James Campus
Program Description: A tri-college collaboration between Algonquin College, George Brown College and Mohawk College for graduates of the Business – Trades diploma program to gain skills in business administration, management, accounting, project management, leadership, communication, and applied research competencies.
Pathway: For graduates of the Business – Trades Ontario College Diploma program, they receive credit for 12 courses and enter the program in semester four.
Contact Email: business@georgebrown.ca

Context:
The Honours Bachelor of Business Administration (Trades Management) is a fully online degree-completion program delivered by Mohawk, Algonquin, and George Brown colleges. It builds on apprenticeship/journeyperson training or trade-related diploma programs. graduates will be prepared to start their own business, manage a small to medium-sized trades-related business, or improve an existing one.

The program is designed for those interested in leadership roles and have an entrepreneurial spirit. It aligns with technological shifts in the industry. Students are required to complete a minimum of 420 hours (equivalent to 14 weeks) of a paid co-op experience in a trades-related organization.

Graduates may choose self-employment as a small business owner or find leadership roles in trades-related fields such as business managers, project managers, quality control managers, maintenance and trades managers, and service-related managers.

Students must successfully complete 27 courses and 1 Integrated Experience to complete their degree, including 23 mandatory courses and 4 Liberal Studies electives.

Skills gained after completion of the program include conducting research for business success, using strategic planning techniques, developing marketing strategies, applying financial information to decision-making.

Career options include self-employment as a small business owner or leadership roles in trades-related fields.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Bachelor of Business Administration (Trades Management) (Honours) (Pathway Business Trades) Program B305 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The text provides information about the course requirements for completing a degree program at the college. Here are the facts extracted from the text:

1. The degree program requires completion of 23 mandatory courses and 4 Liberal Studies electives.
2. Semester 4 course details:
   - ECO 1101: Microeconomics, no pre-requisites
   - ECO 2101: Macroeconomics, requires ECO 1101 as a prerequisite
   - QUA 2002: Statistics, no pre-requisites
   - BACC 1012: Financial Accounting, no pre-requisites
   - BBUS 2105: Principles of Business Management and Research Part II, no pre-requisites
3. Semester 5 course details:
   - BCMP 2017: Computer Business Applications, no pre-requisites
   - MGMT 2013: Risk Management, no pre-requisites
   - XBUS 3500: Professional Practice, no pre-requisites
   - XMKT 3501: Marketing, no pre-requisites
4. Students are required to select two Liberal Studies Electives in Semesters 5 and 6.
5. Semester 6 course details:
   - BLAW 2015: Canadian Business Law, no pre-requisites
   - BACC 2013: Managerial Accounting, no pre-requisites
   - MGT 4602: Project Management, no pre-requisites
   - BFSM 4111: Human Resource Management, no pre-requisites
   - BCOP3002: Work Integrated Learning (CO-OP), no pre-requisites
6. Semester 7 course details:
   - BBUS 4011: Operations Management, no pre-requisites
   - MGT 2015: Managing Small and Medium Enterprises, no pre-requisites
   - MGT 2014: Management Information Systems, no pre-requisites
   - BACC 3014: Finance, no pre-requisites
   - XMKT 4700: Trades Marketing, no pre-requisites
   - XCRE 4701: Capstone Applied Research Project I, no pre-requisites
7. Semester 8 course details:
   - XMGT 4800: Strategic Thinking and Management, no pre-requisites
   - BBUS 4107: International Business, no pre-requisites
   - MGT 2012: Negotiation Strategies, no pre-requisites
   - XCRE 4702: Capstone Applied Research Project II, no pre-requisites
8. Students are required to select one Liberal Studies Elective in Semester 7 and one in Semester 8.
9. Program Learning Outcomes:
   - Support business objectives by leveraging the interdependencies of functional business units including human resources, marketing, finance and accounting.
   - Conduct research to support strategic and operational decisions.
   - Deploy strategic planning techniques to ensure competitive advantage in the trades industry.
   - Apply relevant project and risk management principles and tools to the management of trade businesses.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Bachelor of Business Administration (Trades Management) (Honours) (Pathway Business Trades) Program B305 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The text provides information about a flexible degree program offered by George Brown College in the field of trades business management. Below are some key factual points extracted from the text:

1. Relevant project and risk management principles and tools are applied to the management of trade businesses.
2. Opportunities and challenges in trades businesses are identified and addressed using creative and innovative approaches.
3. Principles of management are applied to the operation of trades business ventures.
4. Marketing of trades-related products or services is planned, implemented, and managed to foster business growth.
5. Compliance with relevant laws, regulations, policies, ethical principles, and industry practices and standards is required.
6. Appropriate software and other technologies are selected and used to meet business goals.
7. Financial information is interpreted using management accounting concepts for strategic decision-making.
8. Discipline-specific practices that contribute to the local and global community through cultural diversity, social responsibility, economic commitment, and environmental stewardship are identified and applied.
9. Tuition fees vary based on the course or courses enrolled in and can be obtained by contacting business@georgebrown.ca.
10. Books and additional supplies are not included in tuition fees and must be purchased separately.
11. The program is approved for OSAP funding.
12. Admission requirements include a post-secondary transcript and departmental review.
13. Eligible professions include Instrumentation and Control Technician, Landscape Horticulturist, Machinist, Steamfitter/Pipe Fitter, Tool and Die Maker, Aerospace/Aviation, Fire Suppression, Military, Sheet Metal Worker, and some other unspecified professions.
14. Some college and university credits may qualify for exemptions.
15. The consent to offer this applied degree has been granted by the Ministry of Colleges and Universities for a seven-year term starting from December 21, 2020. The application for renewal will be submitted 12 months prior to the expiration of the consent.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Bachelor of Business Administration (Trades Management) (Honours) (Pathway Business Trades) Program B305 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context: The George Brown College offers a 12-month advance notice for consent expiration and guarantees a reasonable time frame for students to complete their programs. Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges. Information sessions are held regularly, and students can sign up for an upcoming session. For domestic admission inquiries, contact the Admissions Office at admissions@georgebrown.ca or visit the Admissions section. International students can contact international recruitment representatives by booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry through the International Contact Us page. For financial aid inquiries, contact the Financial Aid Office at FinAid@georgebrown.ca or visit the Financial Aid section. To make an appointment with an Entry Advisor for advice on program options, please review frequently asked questions. The Honours Bachelor of Business Administration (Trades Management) can be contacted through Joyce Manu, Program Co-ordinator, at jmanu@georgebrown.ca. For general inquiries related to the Centre for Business, contact business@georgebrown.ca or call (416) 415-5000 ext. 2160. The program is offered through the School of Management located at St. James Campus at 200 King St. E.
